com.avontell.pagerindicatorbinder

Class IndicatorBinder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.avontell.pagerindicatorbinder.IndicatorBinder

  • public class IndicatorBinder
extends java.lang.Object
    A class that binds together a ViewPager with a view that supports children. The position of the ViewPager will update the view with the children such that the current position is indicated
    Version:
    0.3
    Author:
    Aaron Vontell, Egli Hila

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      IndicatorBinder bind(Context context, android.support.v4.view.ViewPager viewPager, ViewGroup indicatorContainer, int indicatorOnResource, int indicatorOffResource)
      Binds the viewPager to indicatorContainer, such that indicatorContainer has a list of indicators, all displaying the drawable at indicatorOffResource except for the ith child, where i is the position of the viewPager, and whose visual is given by indicatorOffResource.
      static void bindScroll(Context context, ScrollView scrollView, ViewGroup indicatorContainer, int indicatorOnResource, int indicatorOffResource)
      Binds the scrollView to indicatorContainer, such that indicatorContainer has a list of indicators, all displaying the drawable at indicatorOffResource except for the ith child, where i is the ith segment of the scrollview, and each segment is a child in the ScrollView's immediate ViewGroup
      IndicatorBinder bindTextTabs(Context context, android.support.v4.view.ViewPager viewPager, LinearLayout tabContainer, java.util.List<TextView> tabViews, int backgroundSelectedColor, int backgroundUnselectedColor, int textSelectedColor, int textUnselectedColor)
      Binds the viewPager to tabContainer, such that tabContainer serves as a list of clickable tabs that map to sections of the ViewPager.
      private void initializeIndicator()
      Initializes Binder for drawable indicators
      private void initializeTabIndicator()
      Initializes Binder for tab indicators
      void invalidate()
      Refreshes all data for the binder Should be called when the data set changes
      boolean isProgressStyle()
      Returns if the current indicator is set to progress style or not
      void setProgressStyle(boolean progressStyle)
      Set whether the indicators are set to selected as your swipe through the view pager or not Currently only setup to work with bind method Default is false

      • isProgressStyle

        public boolean isProgressStyle()
        Returns if the current indicator is set to progress style or not
        Returns:
        returns true or false

      • setProgressStyle

        public void setProgressStyle(boolean progressStyle)
        Set whether the indicators are set to selected as your swipe through the view pager or not Currently only setup to work with bind method Default is false
        Parameters:
        progressStyle - boolean for progress style

        public void invalidate()
        Refreshes all data for the binder Should be called when the data set changes

      • bind

        public IndicatorBinder bind(@NonNull
                            Context context,
                            @NonNull
                            android.support.v4.view.ViewPager viewPager,
                            @NonNull
                            ViewGroup indicatorContainer,
                            @DrawableRes
                            int indicatorOnResource,
                            @DrawableRes
                            int indicatorOffResource)
        Binds the viewPager to indicatorContainer, such that indicatorContainer has a list of indicators, all displaying the drawable at indicatorOffResource except for the ith child, where i is the position of the viewPager, and whose visual is given by indicatorOffResource. * Note that this attaches an OnPageChangeListener to viewPager. Also note that viewPager must have an adapter attached.
        Parameters:
        context - The calling application
        viewPager - The ViewPager you wish to attach indicators to
        indicatorContainer - The container that will hold each indicator resource
        indicatorOnResource - The drawable to display for indicators that are not selected
        indicatorOffResource - The drawable to display for the selected indicator

      • bindTextTabs

        public IndicatorBinder bindTextTabs(@NonNull
                                    Context context,
                                    @NonNull
                                    android.support.v4.view.ViewPager viewPager,
                                    @NonNull
                                    LinearLayout tabContainer,
                                    @NonNull
                                    java.util.List<TextView> tabViews,
                                    @ColorRes
                                    int backgroundSelectedColor,
                                    @ColorRes
                                    int backgroundUnselectedColor,
                                    @ColorRes
                                    int textSelectedColor,
                                    @ColorRes
                                    int textUnselectedColor)
        Binds the viewPager to tabContainer, such that tabContainer serves as a list of clickable tabs that map to sections of the ViewPager. Pass in a list of TextViews to use in the tab (must be equal to viewPager.getAdapter().getCount()), background colors, and text colors for the selected and unselected states
        Parameters:
        context - The calling application
        viewPager - The ViewPager you wish to attach tabs to
        tabContainer - The Linear Layout that will hold each tab TextView
        tabViews - The list of tabs that you wish to use
        backgroundSelectedColor - The background color resource for a selected tab
        backgroundUnselectedColor - The background color resource for an unselected tab
        textSelectedColor - The text color resource for a selected tab
        textUnselectedColor - The text color resource for an unselected tab

      • bindScroll

        public static void bindScroll(@NonNull
                              Context context,
                              @NonNull
                              ScrollView scrollView,
                              @NonNull
                              ViewGroup indicatorContainer,
                              @DrawableRes
                              int indicatorOnResource,
                              @DrawableRes
                              int indicatorOffResource)
        Binds the scrollView to indicatorContainer, such that indicatorContainer has a list of indicators, all displaying the drawable at indicatorOffResource except for the ith child, where i is the ith segment of the scrollview, and each segment is a child in the ScrollView's immediate ViewGroup
        Parameters:
        context - The calling application
        scrollView - The scrollView you wish to attach indicators to
        indicatorContainer - The container that will hold each indicator resource
        indicatorOnResource - The drawable to display for indicators that are not selected
        indicatorOffResource - The drawable to display for the selected indicator
